text: Sounds like Tory MPs are planning to install a 2nd PM in a row without allowing grassroots members a vote. Means another Remainer will get the job and then agree to a long extension of Article 50. What a stitch-up.
author: oflynnmep

text:
Nobody who voted to keep May in December should be permitted to put themselves forward now.

They are either extremely stupid or they put their own positions before the national interest when dumping her could have made a difference.
author: oflynnmep

text: Knew that would wind you up soon as I saw it.
author: oflynnmep

text: Maybe so. Not my call. Main demo is 4pm Fri and no doubt will run into the evening.
author: oflynnmep

text: It is the day we are supposed to be leaving the EU.
author: oflynnmep

text:
Tory high-ups would love to abandon Brexit altogether to please their corporate sponsors.

The ONLY thing that will stop them is if they see it will destroy their electoral prospects.

So we must get that message across in Parliament Square on Friday. Please come along if you can
author: oflynnmep

text: ITV News unbelievable bias against Brexit just now. Like a PR film for a 2nd referendum. And not a single reminder that the Govt and Opposition promised the people the 2016 result would be implemented.
author: oflynnmep

text: Jeez, even Chuka acknowledging that 15m Remain voters from 2016 have not turned up today to campaign to overturn the referendum result. I have always thought that most of those who voted Remain back then wish to respect democracy and see the result implemented. Reassuring.
author: oflynnmep

text: And at that general election 85% of voters voted for parties promising to implement the referendum result. Around 80% of elected MPs covered. Almost 500 of them had just prior to the contest voted for A50, guaranteeing to voters an EU departure on 29/3/19.
author: oflynnmep

text: Not sure how the voters of Doncaster (69% Leave) will take to being told that it is best for their town if their votes are ignored and their democracy trashed.
author: oflynnmep

text: Dear BBC, this is a rather good story your many journalists seem entirely to have "missed". Perhaps one of them could challenge David Cameron about it next time you doorstep him? Rather than just asking him if he regrets calling the referendum, yeah?
author: oflynnmep

text: I said it would be a disgrace. I think her deal is even worse because it totally locks us in with the EU holding they keys.
author: oflynnmep

text: When will we know?
author: oflynnmep

text: Thanks
author: oflynnmep

text: So having it without the muzzle and chain, though a disgrace, cannot be quite as bad then, yes?
author: oflynnmep

text: Thanks
author: oflynnmep

text: Not bad then? Remainers usually grade me well below that.
author: oflynnmep

text: LOL. That was before the Brexit hoardes arrived!
author: oflynnmep

text: Love it.
author: oflynnmep

text: Do you ever worry that all this is turning you a bit babyish, Alastair?
author: oflynnmep

text: All the constituent elements were certainly accurately dealt with in the headline.
author: oflynnmep

text: It’s great story. Up there with 1991 Mike Gilson conceptual splash “Wet Wednesday in Withernsea” or my own “pavement cracks on Spring Bank”.
author: oflynnmep

text: This is an outrageous assertion surely @DPJHodges ?
author: oflynnmep

text: Not muted you either. Also got other demands on my time.
author: oflynnmep

text: You’ve got a good Handel on this Bill.
author: oflynnmep

text: The fetish for Robinson fractured the Brexit movement. Means most Brexit voters will never again vote for UKIP.
author: oflynnmep

text: Apparently Brahms is taking part, but Mozart couldn’t make it.
author: oflynnmep

text: I know you don’t agree with me. I just wanted to explain my point so at least you know accurately now what it is that you don’t agree with.
author: oflynnmep

text: It has - with May’s support clearly - apparently been able to override a UK Act of Parliament that supposedly guaranteed Brexit date.
author: oflynnmep

text: Even Remainers now despairing at the level of BBC anti-Brexit blitz.
author: oflynnmep

text: This is how insidious EU power is. Brussels has been able to override our much-trumpeted UK law on Brexit Day just by deciding it wants to.
author: oflynnmep

text: Wrong. The WA does not “end free movement” or give us control of waters. Future relationship talks will determine migration/fishing regimes.
author: oflynnmep

text: Don’t often ask for lawyers on here. But can one explain how May can override an Act of Parliament re Brexit Day with a mere letter to EU?
author: oflynnmep

text: My band of crackers does not actually exist as yet, clearly!
author: oflynnmep

text: Mine is also a cracker joke. Just a superior, conceptualist humour brand of cracker.
author: oflynnmep

text: The WA must be defeated and ripped up. It is an anti-patriotic abomination.
author: oflynnmep

text: Wow. A free pass for showbiz paedos from Babs.
author: oflynnmep

text: Can you think of a woman’s name that sounds like “I secretly conspire to break all my promises to the British people”?
author: oflynnmep

text: May deal would end up with customs union, paying £39bn + future payments and virtual FoM as EU screws us in future relationship talks.
author: oflynnmep

text: What that it would be “a disgrace”? Surely you agree? Now tell me why May deal is not even worse?
author: oflynnmep

text: Potentially yes. A Norway outcome would be a disgrace. But would leave potential to kick-on later. May’s “lock in” and dividing UK is worse.
author: oflynnmep

text: I think a so-called “softer Brexit” (Norway-style halfway house) would be a disgrace. But still not quite as bad as May’s “lock in” deal.
author: oflynnmep

text: After breaking her central pledge on the biggest issue of modern times, what makes Theresa May think it appropriate to stay in office?
author: oflynnmep

text: Not so. Already today there has been disruption on roads, there will be a big move against paying TV licence too. Citizen goodwill to the state will be withdrawn. It will, alas, cause social degradation.
author: oflynnmep

text: No I'm not. I have explicitly and repeatedly said I do not condone political violence.
author: oflynnmep

text: Not sure you are in a position to advise former colleagues how to communicate on Twitter, Chappers. Nothing irresponsible about my tweet whatsoever.
author: oflynnmep

text: Civil strife has brought a recession to France.
author: oflynnmep

text:
This clip, in its entirety, is utterly devastating. Promise after promise now being ripped up re "the biggest decision of our lifetime".
British politics becomes anti-democratic next Friday. People are, alas, bound to seek ways other than voting to get their choices implemented.
author: oflynnmep

text: Thurrock and Boston/Skegness would have been won imo. Nigel might well have won Thanet S too. Some more sitting Tories would have switched and stood for UKIP sans ref pledge too.
author: oflynnmep

text: Not right, Toby. Without the referendum pledge UKIP would have won 2-10 seats IMO. Would also have taken more Tory votes so eg Ed Balls would've kept seat. No Tory majority then.
author: oflynnmep

text: He was 16. A kid.
author: oflynnmep

text: England players quickly realise that Declan Rice can receive the ball under pressure and not get caught in possession.
author: oflynnmep

text: Good point. Remain or Remain.
author: oflynnmep

text: Lots of indications tonight that abandoning democracy will lead to serious economic as well as social damage. Corporate sector has not factored this in.
author: oflynnmep

text: Yes. If we dump democracy then economic chaos will follow social chaos.
author: oflynnmep

text: Looks like a decent crowd at Wembley tonight. However, clearly not "a sell-out".
author: oflynnmep

text: "We MPs have deliberately blocked Brexit. Now Brexit is stuck. So let's have a second referendum. Please vote Remain this time."
author: oflynnmep

text: What a very silly thing to say.
author: oflynnmep

text: Told you...
author: oflynnmep

text: Every time they are seen to block democracy they take a reputational hit. But I know how horrible it feels. Seem we can win at the ballot box then still lose :-(
author: oflynnmep

text: The point is that if we don't vote THEY win via a low turnout and are not even exposed as anti-democrats.
author: oflynnmep

text: I will be proud. I have set out to pressurise the Tories to deliver Brexit. And to make them acutely aware of the penalty for non delivery.
author: oflynnmep

text:
The Conservative Party is no longer a coherent party of goveernment - it's not just Mrs May, appalling though she is.

Up to half of Tory MPs won't keep their Brexit promises. Split down the middle on the biggest issue of our times.

The Tories no longer make sense as a party.
author: oflynnmep

text: Welcome aboard
author: oflynnmep

text: I thought Mr Naughtie was already retired on a full final salary pension financed by licence payers? Sounds like he is now on a "double bubble" contract too.
author: oflynnmep

text: Does anyone still think May will have meaningful vote 3 next week? Knowing her can-kicking MO, surely she will leave it to Tue April 10.
author: oflynnmep

text: With his song "At the Videoteque" he foresaw our digital future. A deep political thinker, clearly.
author: oflynnmep

text: Football question for you as an Arsenal expert, Steven. What would you say is the biggest match ever held at the Emirates? Has there ever been a truly mega match at the stadium?
author: oflynnmep

text: Correct.
author: oflynnmep

text: I was told on pretty good authority that BP had a "small state" designation. A natural parting of the ways for you and I after fighting for Brexit shoulder to shoulder all these years!
author: oflynnmep

text: Is this just a sub-group in a knockout, Richard? Where do I get to vote for The Jam?
author: oflynnmep

text: The Jam were the greatest British band, David. It is true that the Stones were - and are - pretty good.
author: oflynnmep

text:
Brexit Party, so far as I can glean, is setting up as small state/libertarian/Thatcherite. Likely to be pro-flat tax and sceptical of the NHS etc.
The SDP believes in better funding for core public services.
We also take a tough line against aggressive tax avoidance by big corps.
author: oflynnmep

text: London is his heartlands.
author: oflynnmep

text: How is she to be replaced, Stewart? Not another MP coup from which grassroots members are excluded, surely?
author: oflynnmep

text: "Not ruling out" device has been the key to Corbyn's bid to be all things to all people on Brexit. A variant of May's approach of ruling out then ruling back in. Both characters deeply sub-standard.
author: oflynnmep

text: I see the Titania McGrath spoofer has created a male equivalent character. It shows real promise.
author: oflynnmep

text: For old time's sake, a #followfriday from me - @LondonSDP
author: oflynnmep

text: I liked my line - that it showed Remain had lost 14m votes since 2016.
author: oflynnmep

text: Eh? Once upon a time there were idiots who threw the term "fascist" at everyone with whom they disagreed like Rik in the Young Ones.
author: oflynnmep

text: Crowds to welcome the Brexit marchers getting bigger every day. March 29, Parliament Square, will be epic.
author: oflynnmep

text: I hear there is some virtual vote going on by Remainers to keep us in the EU and so far they've got 15m fewer votes than they got in 2016.
author: oflynnmep

text: ROFL.
author: oflynnmep

text: Worth considering that the people who consider "no deal" an outrage may be lost to the Tories anyway. My forecast: if it's no deal the Tories will surge in the polls.
author: oflynnmep

text:
I have no doubt that most MPs now bitterly regret handing the decision over EU membership to the British public. But they did. 
Not something you can bail out of halfway through without utterly eviscerating the readiness of the ruled to be ruled when it comes to other areas.
author: oflynnmep

text: Wow, British Army down to 76k. That's not even a Wembley Stadium-full, just about fills Old Trafford.
author: oflynnmep

text: The idea is 3 month granted this week, conditional on WA passing Commons by April 11th. If it doesn't the extension would switch to indefinite and we'd be in Europarl elections too.
author: oflynnmep

text: Thanks
author: oflynnmep

text:
Latest from senior EU source: 3 month extension will only be granted on the proviso that May gets her deal through by April 11th.
If deal not through Commons by then the will EU kill 3 month extension and replace it with offer of "indefinite extension" ie no leaving date at all.
author: oflynnmep

text: Massive preponderance of anti-Brexit talking heads on BBC News at Ten tonight. First time I've watched for a long while. I hoped for some semblance of balance.
author: oflynnmep

text:
For the first time in its long and distinguished history Cambridge University has placed itself in the vanguard of anti-intellectualism and anti the testing of arguments and ideas.
Even in these strange times I am very surprised at this development.
author: oflynnmep

text: Why would any newspaper support the epic fail that is May?Almost as if PMs have some form of goody bag with baubles in it for media bigwigs!
author: oflynnmep

text: Lol
author: oflynnmep

text: I haven’t tweeted about May’s statement because I can’t think of a single even possibly interesting thing to say about it.
author: oflynnmep

text: “To blame for Brexit”? 17.4m answers to that one, Jeremy. To blame for selling it out? About 500 answers, all residing in London SW1.
author: oflynnmep

text: Just what I thought. I’m starting to match you for cynicism re the political process David!
author: oflynnmep

text: Nearly 1,000 yrs since this country backed down to continental European power. Since then we’ve never come to heel. We must not do so now.
author: oflynnmep

text: I think the reason is that people expect May deal to lead to even softer Brexit in the future relationship talks anyway.
author: oflynnmep

text: Etonians, more like.
author: oflynnmep

text: Can we not just Revoke C4 News and have a non-propagandist programme instead?
author: oflynnmep

text: Wow. This is what’s driving the agenda now.
author: oflynnmep

text: If they have EU elections your party won’t be getting any MEPs, Darren.
author: oflynnmep

text: Not sure if May thinks this is a deterrent to Remain MPs blocking Brexit or if she understands, like the rest of us, that it is in fact an incentive.
author: oflynnmep

text: So have I. Was the obvious play, but needed Brussels buy-in. They obv have that now.
author: oflynnmep

text: So May is going to try and get her fake Brexit through on Lab MP votes. They should not bail her out. Let Brexit mean Brexit.
author: oflynnmep

text:
Lots of chatter in Brussels that UK Govt wants to stay in EU but still avoid European elections by nominating Lab and Con stooge peers to be next wave of MEPs.

They are actually trying to ban voting!
author: oflynnmep

text: Not Belch or Aguecheek!
author: oflynnmep

text: A Tory, all day long. Ersatz Brexiteers don't stay the course.
author: oflynnmep

text: And tube trains, esp District Line. Social fabric gone tits up. Moral courage to police vigorously the same.
author: oflynnmep

text: He is not wrong.
author: oflynnmep

text: "Or what are you?". I can see Fox as Malvolio.
author: oflynnmep

text:
During the Peterborough by-election I aim to enthuse voters with @TheSDPUK entire programme.

But if you are a Brexit voter primarily looking to back me to register a protest vote about rank betrayal by Lab and Con, that's ok as well!
author: oflynnmep

text: It’s Parliament AND the Government against the People. And May is the one who has broken by far the most promises to the people.
author: oflynnmep

text: Scott suggests that to use the well-understood term “globalist” is anti-Semitic. The daftest thing I’ve heard in a long time.
author: oflynnmep

text: “End of June” is BS. She is shelving Brexit for two years and then will shelve it some more. The Tories will never deliver Brexit. Horrible.
author: oflynnmep

text: Think we now need a moratorium on Foreign Office ministers till Brexit achieved. No point sending people abroad just to be laughed at.
author: oflynnmep

text: If May can’t get us out next Friday, after three years, why would anyone think she will get us out after two more years? It’s total balls.
author: oflynnmep

text: Hundreds of Tory Remain MPs are keeping May in place just to stop a Leaver becoming PM. Doubt that will change anytime soon.
author: oflynnmep

text: No10 and May have broken so many promises that it is barely worth pondering if they might just be telling the truth. Save time: they aren’t.
author: oflynnmep

text: When will UK police start charging vexatious complainants with wasting police time and start to remember we have free speech in our country?
author: oflynnmep

text: I think the MPs will vote for an extension. If they get away with it with public they will vote to revoke later on.
author: oflynnmep

text: Beware: globalist shills at work.
author: oflynnmep

text: EU to demand a code of good behaviour is signed up to by May before agreeing to lock us in for longer. It’s getting vomit-inducing now.
author: oflynnmep

text:
Leftists in Wales claiming that supporting Brexit makes @TheSDPUK "far right". 
This is what we are up against.
author: oflynnmep

text:
If this Tory Government keeps us in the EU  for Europarl elections on May 23 then it will have become an anti-democratic Remain Govt and not a pro-democratic Leave one. It will never take us out.

We should know by the end of the week - many of us feel we have known for a while.
author: oflynnmep

text: Am honoured to have been elected last night to serve as chairman of the London branch of @TheSDPUK
author: oflynnmep

text: No it isn't. A general election is swamped with competing issues. The only way out is the implementation of the referendum result as promised.
author: oflynnmep

text: Broadcast media still fixated on the processology of Brexit and wilfully missing the biggest political story of the century - the overturning of democracy.
author: oflynnmep

text: This is worse
author: oflynnmep

text: Quite.
author: oflynnmep

text:
People seriously saying that May is going to beg Brussels on Thursday to let her overturn British democracy by shelving Brexit.

Would be by far the most shameful, treacherous and unpatriotic political act of my lifetime by any British leader.

There's your legacy right there, PM
author: oflynnmep

text: Stockpiling against the risk of Brexit was silly. But reading reports of planned trucker blockades suggests that stocking-up against the risk of No Brexit would be rather more sensible.
author: oflynnmep

text: Mellow, man. Ready for what comes.
author: oflynnmep

text: Thought for the day: We talk and we talk till my head explodes. I turned on the news and my body froze. Those braying sheep on my TV screen make this boy shout, make this boy scream: Going underground.
author: oflynnmep

text: We fight on G. We must.
author: oflynnmep

text: Go on, go on, go on, go on.
author: oflynnmep

text: And eight players on its own team - including the captain. - have taken a bung for Remain as well.
author: oflynnmep

text: Petition opens officially tomorrow. But some postal responses already in I believe.
author: oflynnmep

text: thanks
author: oflynnmep

text: I think describing Mrs Duffy as a "bigoted woman" for wanting to control immigration has an equal claim.
author: oflynnmep

text: I see. Well it appears then that he is prone to exaggeration!
author: oflynnmep

text: Diop just needs a rest. He's only 21. He's been great.
author: oflynnmep

text: Surely he meant "county"?
author: oflynnmep

text: The Tory Party is now Remain. Have you not been watching the news?
author: oflynnmep

text: As you can see, I'm facing lots of pro-EU, anti-Brexit parties in the looming Peterborough by-election which I shall fight for @TheSDPUK on a WTO Brexit platform. All support gratefully received.
author: oflynnmep

text: May repeatedly promised to honour the referendum and get us out on March 29. Now she is going to Brussels to beg the EU for a "long extension" to our membership. What does a PM have to do to get fired these days?
author: oflynnmep

text: Nicely put.
author: oflynnmep

text: That is Atletico Madrid stadium, not Barcelona. So it is AM's attendance, not Barca's.
author: oflynnmep

text: Two years refers to the manifestos presented at the last general election.
author: oflynnmep

text: NB Tories re threat of "No Brexit". No Brexit will not be the end point to this story. Just the end point of the Tories.
author: oflynnmep

text: "No Brexit" is not an end point to this story. Just an end point to the Tories.
author: oflynnmep

text:
Conceptually this is anti-intellectual nonsense from Mogg.

Is it possible to conceive of a worse position even than EU membership? Yes, of course it is. 

Is May's deal such an entity? Yes, of course it is. 

As he said himself, complete "vassalage". Very disappointing.
author: oflynnmep

text: Her "legacy"?! Only someone with zero emotional intelligence could fail to appreciate that is already set in stone. Mrs May appears to think she can magic up an initiative to counterbalance what she has done on and to Brexit. Unbelievable.
author: oflynnmep

text: This prob needs a non-Tory photo on too, Lucy. Kate Hoey merits a mention!
author: oflynnmep

text: SDP London branch meeting has free cup cakes this evening thanks to Birthday Boy @BergdahlJB Now even more of an unmissable occasion!
author: oflynnmep

text: Looking forward to seeing on the campaign trail in Peterborough.
author: oflynnmep

text: Lol. Any adult who takes Fireman Sam seriously should not be allowed anywhere near the Fire Brigade!
author: oflynnmep

text: Very restrained.
author: oflynnmep

text: What happens when you ask Alexa who Siri is and vice-versa? Do they engage in big fight-type tech trash talk about each other?
author: oflynnmep

text: Why would anyone believe long-term pension policy promises of the British state when it is trashing Brexit promises made only two years ago?
author: oflynnmep

text:
Day after day broadcast media, which hyped economic challenges of Brexit for month after month, is now failing to cover the trashing of democracy inherent in the beach of Brexit promises by Govt and Opposition.

A monumental failing born of overwhelming Remain bias of personnel.
author: oflynnmep

text: You are not allowed to do that. Revocation is permanent.
author: oflynnmep

text: Tory MP explaining that the Govt is already carefully planning how it will break its central promise to the British people, negating their votes in the process. So that's ok then...
author: oflynnmep

text: It's an old phrase used by Aneurin Bevan of Hugh Gaitskill
author: oflynnmep

text: So the desiccated calculating machine thinks he has stolen our democracy. The long-term consequences will show him what a stupid thing to do that was.
author: oflynnmep

text: So will I.
author: oflynnmep

text: https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/brexit/8654605/boris-johnson-to-back-pm-brexit-deal/ … Why would becoming Continuity May help Boris Johnson become prime minister?
author: oflynnmep

text: To be the party that never endorsed it and win support for a campaign for real Brexit as its appalling consequences unfold.
author: oflynnmep

text: My view is that explicitly small state,  right-wing new parties will never break into the Commons. A pro-Brexit party of the common sense centre does not have that limiting factor at the outset.
author: oflynnmep

text:
There are two sheet anchors for Brexit. One is a profound belief in national sovereignty, the other a profound belief in democracy.
The SDP has both in its declaration of aims and values.
The Westminster parties, with the possible exception of the DUP, have neither.
author: oflynnmep

text: That's not what my tweet said. I have in fact long doubted how genuine many of the Tory MPs were. With some honourable exceptions of course.
author: oflynnmep

text: Wrong. They will use threat of backstop to screw us on fishing, migration and countless other things. They will have pocketed our £39bn too.
author: oflynnmep

text:
I am reminded more than ever today that only a handful of Tory MPs were campaigners for Brexit before the 2015 election. 
The commitment of most now appears to have been opportunist and careerist, activated only once the referendum was called.
Very disappointing to say the least.
author: oflynnmep

text:
Tory MP after Tory MP is today folding on Brexit and saying they will back May's deal that will take our great country to a position worse and less free and less independent even than EU membership. Sickening.
#notinmyname
author: oflynnmep

text: https://www.express.co.uk/news/politics/1101155/brexit-news-theresa-may-brexit-deal-vote-no-deal-brexit-latest-eu-uk/amp?__twitter_impression=true … Appalling. Actively threatening Brexit voters with no Brexit in order to get her fake Brexit through. She has lied to us so many times.
author: oflynnmep

text: this
author: oflynnmep

text: From the bench, yes. As a starter, no.
author: oflynnmep

text: If the Tories cannot be trusted to keep their central promises then it doesn't matter what their policies are, does it? It all becomes post-departure posturing.
author: oflynnmep

text: Anderson plays too narrow. We lacked width and crosses for far too long today.
author: oflynnmep

text: Swansea's second goal today was very, very good. Also that Modish target on their shirts by sponsor's name is so cool.
author: oflynnmep

text: I so agree. Let them have to look us in the eye if they are going to kill democracy.
author: oflynnmep

text: X
author: oflynnmep

text: UK banking sector maybe not going to decamp to Paris post-Brexit after all.
author: oflynnmep

text: Fair play to all braving the mud and the rain to march for Brexit. Ignore the sneering Remainer commentariat. By the time you reach London you will be greeted as heroes by huge numbers of Brexit voters from all over the country.
author: oflynnmep

text: I agree with Dan. The only reason for Tory Brexiteers to vote for this is if they are putting party before country.
author: oflynnmep

text: The quality of that match was terrible. West Ham's football was terrible. But somehow three points at the end.
author: oflynnmep

text: Anderson very poor too. So sloppy.
author: oflynnmep

text: Me too Bill. Day of celebration or day of outrage. Parliament Square the place to be.
author: oflynnmep

text: What is it Wayne?
author: oflynnmep

text: We believe the state needs to start building houses again.
author: oflynnmep

text: Yes. All true.
author: oflynnmep

text: I see from their latest adverts that buying TM Lewin shirts enriches Gary Lineker further. Oh well, lots of other outlets to choose from.
author: oflynnmep

text: Shame that equation yields the opposite result for the product known as "a house" Douglas.
author: oflynnmep

text: My heroine? That's a pretty big assumption you just made.
author: oflynnmep

text: Not really. Was excessive class conflict and excessive trades union power impairing productive capacity. Although many aspects of society were more harmonious than now.
author: oflynnmep

text: Yes but maybe because they misspelled his name.
author: oflynnmep

text: You just RTd a tweet predicting riots if Brexit is shelved, Albert!
author: oflynnmep

text: Very narrow range of commentators on R4 Week In Westminster, even by its usual standards. Three outright anti-Brexit journalists and one supporter of Mrs May. BBC still struggling to put pro-Brexit commentators on air.
author: oflynnmep

text:
The Tories for decades posed as the patriotic party. Now they are revealed to be no more than the party of Northern Europe Production Zone B, with an eye on their own future  boardroom opportunities.
Being forced to show their true colours will have huge consequences.
author: oflynnmep

text: Welcome aboard
author: oflynnmep

text: Into the valley of death rode the 4,000, theirs not to reason why...
author: oflynnmep

text:
If Parliament revokes A50 the Tory Party will be replaced within 10yrs by a pro-Brexit party that will take us out properly by winning a general election on a leave platform.

FPTP only protects parties who at least to some extent look after their core support.
author: oflynnmep

text: The change will come very fast once a new pro-Brexit, pro-democracy offer gets a bit of traction. Support for the big two increasingly under sufferance.
author: oflynnmep

text: Most Leavers were telling the Tories this from the start. Almost like we were deliberately ignored....
author: oflynnmep

text: This is just a tiny part of what is going to  happen to the Tories if they don't get us out of the EU - properly - at the end of this month.
author: oflynnmep

text: The Jam, mate.
author: oflynnmep

text: Yes quite. This was the approach I and most other Leavers I know recommended from the word go. Instead we had May/Robbins "what would you like us to do?" approach towards the EU.
author: oflynnmep

text: After carelessly letting Cardiff get to 28 points with eight games left, they also now need to put at least three more on the board before they book their holidays. Lots of tough games left too.
author: oflynnmep

text: Yes exactly.
author: oflynnmep

text: Unsettling image of the day.
author: oflynnmep

text: Wow. That's another beauty.
author: oflynnmep

text: Thanks. Will take a look when I have more time on my hands (hopefully very soon!). Hope you are keeping well.
author: oflynnmep

text: Thanks Peter
author: oflynnmep

text: This is the sign I was talking about. Isn't it glorious?
author: oflynnmep

text: thanks for this. Am going to tweet it out now!
author: oflynnmep

text: Thanks
author: oflynnmep

text: Well put
author: oflynnmep

text: Thanks. Does the sign grab you in the same way it does me?
author: oflynnmep

text: Lord Kerr predicted we "will come to heel" and bow down to Brussels. Donald Tusk appears to think that MPs voting to take no deal off the table means this is now certain. He has the handcuffs ready and the cell door already open. Let's not walk inside.
author: oflynnmep

text: A bit off-piste here, Twitter. Rowan's Bowling Alley by Finsbury Park station has the most evocative neon sign I've ever seen - a blaze of colour on chilly nights. I often see it as I go by on the train. But can anyone tell me, what is it like inside?
author: oflynnmep

text: We lose our financial leverage and the EU gains the Sword of Damocles backstop before we start talking future relationship. May approach will not end well for our country.
author: oflynnmep

text: Don't say that. Other upsides may well occur to you yet
author: oflynnmep
